thread.title: Kings beat San Antonio 95-92 in Aldridge's Spurs debut
thread.title_full: Kings beat San Antonio 95-92 in Aldridge's Spurs debut

title: Kings beat San Antonio 95-92 in Aldridge's Spurs debut
text:
Kings beat San Antonio 95-92 in Aldridge's Spurs debut Spurs played without 'Big 3', Diaw, coach Popovich Posted: 2:34 AM, October 09, 2015 Updated: 2:34 AM, October 09, 2015 San Antonio Spurs forward LaMarcus Aldridge, right, looks to shoot against Sacramento Kings center Willie Cauley-Stein during the first quarter of an NBA preseason basketball game Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in Sacramento, Calif. (AP Photo/Rich Pedroncelli) 
SACRAMENTO, Calif. - Rudy Gay had 26 points and seven rebounds as the Sacramento Kings held on to beat the San Antonio Spurs 95-92 in the Spurs' first preseason game Thursday night. 
The Spurs played without Tim Duncan, Tony Parker and Manu Ginobili, who didn't make the trip. Nor did Boris Diaw or head coach Gregg Popovich. Assistant coach Ettore Messina ran the Spurs in their preseason opener. 
LaMarcus Aldridge shot 3 for 10 and finished with eight points and three rebounds in his Spurs debut. Newcomer David West had five points in 23 minutes. Reigning NBA defensive player of the year Kawhi Leonard scored 16 points and former first round draft pick Kyle Anderson had 15 points and 4 rebounds in 26 minutes. 
Patty Mills started at point guard for the Spurs and had 11 points and five assists. 
Rajon Rondo in his debut for Sacramento had 10 assists, eight points and eight rebounds. Marco Belinelli, who played with the Spurs last season, had 10 of his 19 points in the fourth quarter. 
Kings all-star center DeMarcus Cousins had 17 points and 10 rebounds. 
Gay had a huge first half, hitting two 3-pointers and scoring 18 points. Gay was 6-of-7 on 3-pointers and had 30 points Wednesday in a four-point loss in Phoenix. 
LADIES' NIGHT: Kings assistant coach Nancy Lieberman and the Spurs' Becky Hammon were on opposing benches. Hammon became the first female NBA assistant coach a year ago and Lieberman joined George Karl's staff this summer. 
UP NEXT: The Spurs visit Miami on Monday Oct. 12. Copyright 2015 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
